title: Paedophile who attacked girl, 4, jailed after victim spotted him in news story
text:

A predatory pedophile dad locked up for sex crimes has received a sentence extension after a victim saw his story on a news website.

Michael Deakin was serving a 10 year sentence for the sexual abuse of young children when a report of his crimes was published on Stoke Sentinel.

Another victim of his, who was just four at the time of attack, saw the article and reported her experiences to the police.

Now the dad-of-six, formerly of Hanford in Staffordshire but now of no-fixed-abode, has been handed an extra 32 months inside for the latter crime.

Deakin took his victim away from children she was playing with into another room and then sexually assaulted her, prosecutor Andrew Wallace told Stoke-on-Trent Crown Court.

He pleaded guilty to indecent assault.

“He has a sexual interest in children," the lawyer said.

(Image: Stoke Sentinel/BPM Media)

“There has been a couple of times in the past where the victim has tried to report it but she was only four at the time so did not understand.

“She started self-harming when she was 13 and finally reported the crime in 2018.

“Deakin has been before the court 11 times for 38 offences dating back to 1979, at the age of 18, when he was convicted of three counts of inappropriate activity with a child and was given borstal training.”

In 2016 he was given a decade long stretch inside for photographing himself performing a sex act on a child.

He also abused a teenager and made another child pose for photos before watching her bathe.

Police later uncovered an 11,000 photo stash of child porn in his possessions.

Rashad Mohammed, mitigating, told the court his client had undergone courses to address his offending while in prison.

He added: “He has expressed regret about what he did. He has six children and every time he sees them it reminds him of what he has done.

“He is a talented artist and while in prison has just put his head down and got on with it. He has been working while in custody in the workshop and is a model prisoner.”

For the most recent conviction, Judge Dean Kershaw handed the serial paedophile a sentence that will only begin when his current one ends.

“I have read the victim impact statement and it is harrowing," the judge said.

"This has affected her.

“The victim was a very, very young child, some may even say a toddler. You managed to get away with this offence for all of these years.

“You were in your late 30s and took advantage of a situation that arose.

“The victim has suffered, I won’t read out her statement in court, but it has had an impact on her. It had an effect on her relationship with her mother who did not initially believe her.”

Deakin is already on the sex offenders’ register for life after the previous conviction.

He will also have to spend 12 months on licence following his current jail term.
description: Michael Deakin was handed a sentence extension after one of his victims spotted the serial sex offender in an online article
